entries.meaning: Knee-length breeches, worn especially in the 18th century.
examples: Even fashions, otherwise convenient, as the trousers that have so long taken place of smallclothes, often perhaps owe their continuance to some general defect . . .

entries.meaning: (Britain, archaic) Underwear and other small items of clothing.
examples: Are red socks a secret handshake, a mark of Etonhood, of an allegiance to the place both claimed and disclaimed? And having seen one pair I'm noticing them all over the place, a conspiracy of smallclothes.
